gov.va.med.srcalc.util

Class DisplayNameConditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.srcalc.util.DisplayNameConditions

  • public class DisplayNameConditions
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for storing conditions that pertain to display names and their constraints. Display names have been standardized across the application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISPLAY_NAME_MAX
      The maximum length of a valid display name: 80.
      static java.lang.String VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_CHARACTERS
      English description of the valid display name characters for readable error messages.
      static java.util.regex.Pattern VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_PATTERN
      A pre-compiled version of VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX for efficiency.
      static java.lang.String VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX
      A regular expression that defines a valid displayName: "[\\w ~`!@#$%^&*()-_+=|\\.,<>/?\'\":;]*"

      • VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_CHARACTERS

        public static final java.lang.String VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_CHARACTERS

        See Also:
        VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX, Constant Field Values

      • VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX

        public static final java.lang.String VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX

        A regular expression that defines a valid displayName: "[\\w ~`!@#$%^&*()-_+=|\\.,<>/?\'\":;]*"

        Note that this expression permits a string of any length. Validation code should check the string length first with a length-specific error message.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_PATTERN

        public static final java.util.regex.Pattern VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_PATTERN
        A pre-compiled version of VALID_DISPLAY_NAME_REGEX for efficiency.
